en.title: Critical Run Speed (CRS) Calculator - Free Test & Training Zones
en.description: Free CRS calculator for runners. Test your Critical Run Speed in 2 trials, get instant training zones + threshold pace. Start optimizing your training!
en.content: Critical Run Speed (CRS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Running Training What is Critical Run Speed (CRS)? Critical Run Speed (CRS) is the theoretical maximum running velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CRS is calculated using a 5K and 3K time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Run Speed (CRS) represents the theoretical maximum

en.title: SWOLF Calculator: Measure Running Efficiency | Lower is Better
en.description: SWOLF calculator for running efficiency. Calculate your score, compare with benchmarks, and track progress. Lower SWOLF = faster running with less effort.
en.content: Running Efficiency: Running Efficiency Your Stride Economy Score - Lower is Better What is Running Efficiency? Running Efficiency (Run + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stride count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. Formula Running Efficiency = Kilometer Time (seconds) + Stride Count Example: If you run 25m in 20 seconds with 15 strides: Running Efficiency = 20 + 15 = 35 Normalized Running Efficiency for Track Comparison To compare

en.title: Stride-Mechanics - RunAnalytics - Running Analytics App | Critical Running Speed, TSS, CTL/ATL/TSB for iOS
en.description: Track Critical Running Speed, Training Stress Score, and performance metrics with RunAnalytics. Science-based iOS app for runners, triathletes & coaches. 7-day free trial.
en.content: Stride Mechanics The Biomechanics of Running Speed The Fundamental Equation of Running Speed The Velocity Equation Velocity = Stride Rate (SR) √ó Distance Per Stride (DPS) Translation: How fast you run depends on how often you stride (SR) multiplied by how far you travel per stride (DPS). This deceptively simple equation governs all running performance. To get faster, you must either: Increase Stride Rate (turnover faster) while maintaining DPS Increase Distance Per Stride (travel farther per str

en.title: Free Running TSS Calculator - Calculate Training Stress Score (rTSS)
en.description: FREE running TSS calculator. Quantify workout intensity using CRS pace + duration. Get your rTSS score, weekly guidelines, and track fitness over time.
en.content: Free Running TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for running workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Running TSS (sTSS)? Running Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a running workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Run Speed (CRS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CRS pace = 100 sTSS. Free sTSS Calculator Calculate training stress for any running workout. Requires your CRS

en.title: Running TSS Calculator: Training Load & PMC (CTL/ATL/TSB)
en.description: Learn running Training Stress Score (rTSS) calculation and Performance Management Chart metrics (CTL, ATL, TSB). Track fitness and fatigue scientifically. Includes worked examples, weekly TSS targets, and taper strategies.
en.content: Training Load & Performance Management Quantifying Stress, Tracking Fitness, Optimizing Performance Understanding Training Load Training load quantification answers the critical question: How hard was that workout? Not just distance or time, but the true physiological stress imposed on your body. The Training Stress Score (TSS) system, developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, provides a standardized method to quantify workout intensity and duration into a single number. For running, we use Run Training S

en.title: Running Training Zones Guide - CRS-Based Intensity Zones Explained
en.description: Master 5 running training zones based on CRS. Learn Zone 2 base building, Zone 4 threshold work, Zone 5 VO2max. Free calculator + workout examples included.
en.content: Running Training Zones - CRS-Based Intensity Guide Master the 5 training zones for running - Personalized to your Critical Run Speed What Are Running Training Zones? Training zones are scientifically defined intensity ranges based on your Critical Run Speed (CRS) ‚Äîyour aerobic threshold pace. Each zone triggers specific physiological adaptations, from aerobic base building (Zone 2) to VO‚ÇÇmax development (Zone 5). Training zones eliminate guesswork and ensure every workout has a clear purpose. Wh
